comment.text: BCG vaccinated: No Mycobacterial infections: M. smegmatis
hepatosplenomegaly, peripheral lymphadenopathy, fever, wasting, chronic anemia, hyperleukocytosis, renal failure with anuria (required dialysis)
renal biopsy specimens revealed vasculitis due to chronic mycobacterial disease.

consequence.term: a frame shift duplication mutation in the exon 2 leading to a premature stop codon in the EC domain
a point mutation in the intron 2 leading to an amino acid change

comment.text: BCG vaccinated: Yes Mycobacterial infections: Mycobacterium bovis
Other clinical features: fever, regional adenitis, cachexia, granulomatous dermatitis, hepatosplenomegaly, lymph-node enlargement, diffuse pneumonitis, multiple osteolytic lesions

consequence.term: a frame shift deletion mutation in the exon 2 leading to a premature stop codon in the EC domain

comment.text: Mycobacterial infections: M. fortui

Other clinical features: fever, night sweats, lymphadenopathy, splenomegaly, reactive hyperplasia. He developed erosion of the head of the left femur, collapse of his seventh thorasic vertebra, and clerosis of several other vertebrate
